abstract: Apple’s board needs to put out a straightforward, unambiguous statement about the health of Steven Jobs.
snippet: Apple’s board needs to put out a straightforward, unambiguous statement about the health of Steven Jobs.
lead_paragraph: The last time I wrote about Steve Jobs, and Apple’s insistence that his health problem be kept secret, I got an e-mail message from my friend Lise Buyer, a former Silicon Valley stock analyst (and former Google executive), who took issue with my belief that the company owed its investors more disclosure. In the past, she wrote, she had agreed with me that Apple was being too cute in its disclosures, but now that he was about to take a six-month leave, things were different.

headline.main: Steve Jobs and Apple: Here We Go Again
